channel.title: VPS/Virtual Machine/Ports question. Unable to allow others to connect
channel.description:
Quick question.
I'm on a mac, but I have a win7 VM installed, so I code and do my server on that. I'm having tons of issues getting other people to connect to the server and I'm pretty sure it has to do with the fact that I'm on a VM - the ports get all screwed up, I can't properly port-forward ect.
Two questions: 1) Does anyone know how to get others to access my server, even if I'm running it through a VM? 2) If I use a vps to host the site once I'm finished coding it and stuff, does it even matter? They're hosting it, so isn't the only concern THEIR ports, ect. I guess the point with this question is: If I use a VPS to host the server, can I leave my current NON-WORKING settings for others to get on alone, and would people still be able to connect because its through a VPS?
Any help would be appreciated. My skype is Flubby_PB if you think you can assist me. This has been going on for days now.. :(

item.title: VPS/Virtual Machine/Ports question. Unable to allow others to connect
item.dc:creator: @Mr.czar Mr.czar
item.description:
@Mr.czar wrote:

[quote=“Andy1993, post:4, topic:509553”]Make sure the ports are 43594… make sure your No-ip is online, and you’ve typed your ip in the Client side “client.java” or gui.java.
Also VPS’s firewall are always ready to play basicly…[/quote]

The ports are always open, but the firewalls still block them until you unblock them yourself.

Read full topic
item.source: VPS/Virtual Machine/Ports question. Unable to allow others to connect

Also VPS’s firewall are always ready to play basicly…
